Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Easy Access to the LBJ”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandHolli
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little older. However, for the price, it's a great value. The breakfast is good, the wifi is fast and they are right off of the 635/LBJ. Pool is clean and the staff is helpful. They could smile a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Stormey L
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a laquinta before and had a reLly great experience. I set my reservations for 3/18/12-3/24/12, I spent almost $300. I requested to be on the bottom floor because I was vacationing with my 3 young children (including an infant) i also rented this hotel because of the small yard and pool/spa. the receptionist failed to tell me that there was going to be construction a door away from me. The noise was so loud that I couldn't even lay my 1 year old down for a nap. After the first day, they closed the pool for "construction" the receptionist said they were putting in a lift, but yet not a single worker had been out there. I had requested a different room repeatedly but never was able to get one. Finally the day before we were to leave, I was offered a different room and the pool was "going to get cleaned" after I told them I just wanted my money back for the remaining day. Overall, complimentary breakfast was good, wifi was good, room was decent, and the house cleaning ladies always made sure we had enough towels, (in case we went swimming) but the receptionist need a good class in hospitality. I WILL NOT BE BACK!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: Blur_78
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this la quinta at two different business travels, I can say its location is great, you can easily drive to this hotel, rooms are big, it is not a new hotel, so I noticed that some parts of the room seemed worn, specially the tub at the bathroom. If you've stayed at la quinta you know what to expect, I didn't found any disguising or happy surprise here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Charmaine C
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here one night, but the room was inexpensive, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: CRYSTALST
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week for business...price is right. Located where I had to be. Older hotel but kept very clean. Parking can be an issue. Also was not happy that side doors were not kept locked at all times. Located on busy expressway can be noisy I bet when air is not running. Good Value.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Camille R
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the worst I have ever stayed in. It was dirty, the ceilings offer no sound barrier (the family staying on the floor above us sounded like a herd of elephants just walking around), and the worst part...BUGS! I saw three different varieties during our stay and my husband woke up with a strange rash on his chest. Usually LQ hotels are good, but this was HORRIBLE! Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ned4me
Reviews.Content: The parking lot was small and the parking spaces were narrow and cramped, making it hard to get luggage in and out of the car without banging the doors into the car next to you. This is an older hotel so we werenâ€™t expecting a resort atmosphere, and were pleased by the first impressions as we entered the lobby. The dÃ©cor was modest but not ratty looking and the reception area was clean and smelled fresh. We had booked the reservation online so the check-in process was smooth. The front desk staff was very friendly, checked us in quickly, and answered all our questions. We requested a non-smoking room. With this being an older hotel, I was a bit leery about how the room would smell. Older hotels often just repaint or try to mask the stale smoke odor in the carpet, drapes, bedding and mattresses. So we get off the elevator to go to our room and instantly smell the tell-tell smell â€¦ the floor we were on might not be a smoking floor now but it definitely used to be! But much to our surprise, our room smelled nice and fresh with no hint of stale smoke. I was very glad because I donâ€™t think I could have spent the night smelling stale cigarette odor. The carpet was a bit worn in a few places and there were some minor stains, but there werenâ€™t any rips or tears in it. Our room had plenty of lights on every wall and a couple in the ceiling, so there was plenty of bright light when we wanted it. When it came time to go to bed, the drapes kept out the light from outside. Our room faced the parking lot but the drapes were heavy enough to block out the streetlights and parking lot lights at night. The beds were very comfortable, nice and soft just the way I like them. I would have preferred to have more blankets, but didn't bother to ask for them. The sheets were a soft sateen material and the pillows were stuffed with a thick and fluffy down-like material. There were also plenty of pillows, three per bed. Free high-speed internet connection (either wireless or Ethernet) was available. The speed was actually quite fast. I was using a wireless connection and it never dropped the signal. There was a large desk with plenty of electrical outlets for plugging in a laptop and other accessories. The television had a great picture and nice selection of channels. It sat on top of a large dresser with plenty of drawers. The heat and air conditioning unit worked adequately. The built-in thermostat kept the room nice and cozy. The room itself was a bit cramped with two queen beds and all the other furniture, but was really that bothersome. The standard amenities were included such as a hairdryer, iron & ironing board, alarm clock, and coffee maker. I was glad to see they had included decaf coffee as well as regular. There was also a refrigerator and microwave in the room, which was convenient. The bathroom had a large mirror, a fair amount of counter space, nice clean toilet and shower. The tile on the floor was clean. The complimentary bar soap wasnâ€™t impressive and didnâ€™t smell very good, and the small bottle of shampoo didnâ€™t smell very good either. There were no complimentary bottles of conditioner or lotion. The massage-type shower head and was in excellent condition and the water pressure was fantastic. The water in the shower and sink area heated up quickly. There were plenty of fluffy towels and washrags available and they looked fairly new. There was extra toilet paper and facial tissue tucked away in a little compartment. The only major complaint I had about the bathroom area was the lack of an exhaust fan so the mirror fogged up from shower. This particular hotel is located right off a very busy expressway and we could hear the traffic noise if we turned off the AC unit, but the soothing white noise from the fan blocked out the street noise. We also didnâ€™t hear any sounds from the guests on either side of us, and one of those rooms had 4 teenage boys in it! There were plenty of vending machines on each floor for sodas, water, or snacks â€¦ and the snacks were actually fresh. The ice machines were conveniently located and worked like a charm. The free breakfast was fabulous with a wide variety of food such as waffles, sausage, biscuits and gravy, fruit, 4 types of bagels, 2 choices of cereal, several different flavors of muffins, donuts and pastries, 2 kinds of juice, milk, and coffee. The breakfast area was very large and had a nice layout. It was also very well maintained and clean. I took a peek at the room service menu and the prices were surprisingly within â€œreal worldâ€� prices. The hotel also has a swimming pool, spa, and fitness center but I didnâ€™t use them and canâ€™t comment on their condition. I would recommend this location to anyone and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “I will be coming back for sure”
Reviews.Author: Devlesa
Reviews.Content: We had to travel on short notice to Dallas -- unfortunately to say goodbye to my grandmother who was dying. When we arrived there was a problem with our reservation (we had reserved a non-smoking king room). Turns out they were out of non-smoking king and because of breathing problems, the smoking rooms were not acceptable (they really smelled of smoke!). Given what was going on with my grandmother, I was pretty upset, but the young man working the desk took care of it quickly. We got bumped up to a HUGE suite, for the same rate as the king, for our entire stay. It was beautiful and really, though it sounds silly, it was nice to unwind in a pretty room after the stressful days with family. I still have cause to go to Dallas a few times a year to visit other family and for business, and from now on, I'll be making my reservations at this hotel. Thank you guys for making an unhappy trip a little better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: frhays
Reviews.Content: At $62 a night this represents a great value! I really liked the fact that we had a non-smoking king room (bed was just OK comfortwise), micro-frig, microwave, coffeemaker, free wireless (albeit a bit slow), continental breakfast (complete with waffles and eggs), fitness center (basic cardio machines only) and free parking. If you looked real close this property is starting to show its age but still represents a great value. Close by to CVS, Subway, Starbucks and Quiznos (easy walking distance) and close by to other major hotels (I attended a confereence at the Westin Central and it is within walking distance. Staff is friendly enough (some more so than others) Has an outdoor pool and hot tub but the hot tub was not working when we stayed for our week stay.

Reviews.Title: “A flexible hotel, amazing!”
Reviews.Author: TexasLight
Reviews.Content: This La Quinta was perfectly acceptable at a VERY nice price. It was in an easy to navigate area. I get lost in a paper bag but was able to find my way around easily. Room was clean, nice lobby and the outside pool looked inviting, especially in Dallas in August. What I REALLY appreciated was staff's ability to change my internet reservation on the spot. When I made the reservation online I thought it would just be me so I reserved 1 king size bed. Well the stars were aligned and my 2 teenagers were able to come with me at the last minute. When we checked in and the desk clerk reminded me of my room selection I asked if there was any way I could get 2 beds. No problem. I had to pay $20 more but since I started at $55.00 that wasn't really a problem. I tried to do something similar at another hotel chain and they wouldn't do a thing because the reservation had made been online. This was the first La Quinta I had stayed at in a long time. Due to the acceptable environment, liberal cancellation policy, nice price and their ability to adapt to my life they've made a friend in me.

Reviews.Title: “Looks deserted..but neat rooms..good price”
Reviews.Author: ashtop
Reviews.Content: I don't know if it was the location or a quality of Dallas. But the area looked more like an industrial zone. But it had its share CVS' and burger joints nearby....so you have access to all your basic amenities..even at night. Rooms were clean, spacious...pretty too. Decent service. Had to wait at the counter for someone who could attend to us, almost every time we were at the counter!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel at a great rate!”
Reviews.Author: Trekmom02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the La Quinta with other family members in town for a wedding. I shared a 2 queen room with my mother-in-law. The room was quite comfortable. The beds were great. Other family members, 2 adults and 2 children, age 6 and 3, stayed in one of the king suites. It was very large and quite comfortable. The only downside was that we had been hoping for a separate bedroom as in a wall between the bedroom area and the living area. But it was all one room. The breakfast buffet was substantial. I do like the Belgian waffle maker! There was a fitness center - had three machines in working order. They did not have a business center, but they did have a computer for guests' use. The location was quite convenient and very accessible. And, you could get to a CVS pharmacy through parking lots without even going on a city street. We paid a really good rate and definitely got our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “NO HOT WATER”
Reviews.Author: vbailey2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the La Quinta Park Central, LBJ Freeway in Dallas on May 14-16. When I checked in it was 85 degrees outside an no A/C was on in my room. Then I had no hot water for 2 days, being promised it would be fixed each morning. I finally checked out and went to the Quality Inn & Suites next door where they still understand the concept of Customer Service! I usually choose the La Quinta in Addison on Landmark Blvd, but chose this alternation location as it was more central to the activities I needed to attend. The front desk staff were not at all eager to offer a refund, even though I only stayed an extra night because the assured me there would be hot water by Friday night/Saturday morning. I would NOT recommend this hotel. The Fitness Center was not kept cool (again, 85 degrees outside and no A/C on), and the rooms looked old.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: luke213
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay, front desk staff was great. We have been staying in hotels for my wife's work for the last 3 weeks all over the country and I think this was the best LaQuinta we've stayed in so far. No additional pet fee's and I felt comfortable leaving my car in the lot. It's across the street from a church, overall just a good stay. We did have a problem with our room but it was corrected immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here a lot”
Reviews.Author: GloriaMunday
Reviews.Content: We were especially fortunate to stay here on very short notice during Mary Kay month in Dallas. We had a room for under $100.00. In a perfect location for on and off the highway. When there developed a damp carpet ( ac problem) in the room we were moved to a suite for the remaining time of our stay. We make our own reservations using Hardin as the discount code. It is usually a good savings on price.

Reviews.Title: “LaQuinta quality amenities, BUT...”
Reviews.Author: GloreBee
Reviews.Content: LaQuinta quality amenities, but problems with ALOT of noise from neighboring rooms very early in the morning, slamming doors constantly. I spoke with desk manager after an hour of hoping it would get better. He stated he did not hear it even though it was very close in proximity to the desk and kept happening. Nothing at all was done about it.. Very frustrating and we will never stay there again. The door slamming lasted for an hour and a half. If we hadn't purchased the hotel room through a third party, we would have demanded a refund. Not a good experience.

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn Dallas LBJ/Central
HotelInfo.Address: 7815A LBJ Freeway, Dallas, TX 75251
